required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Exploring the Effect of Crizanlizumab on Kidney Function in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease Caused by Sickle Cell Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Multicenter, Randomized, Open Label Two Arm Study Comparing the Effect of Crizanlizumab + Standard of Care to Standard of Care Alone on Renal Function in Sickle Cell Disease Patients ≥ 16 Years With Chronic Kidney Disease Due to Sickle Cell Nephropathy

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to compare the efficacy and safety of crizanlizumab + standard of care to standard of care alone on renal function in sickle cell disease patients ≥ 16 years with chronic kidney disease due to sickle cell nephropathy.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with ≥ 30% decrease in albuminuria (ACR)
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on albuminuria (ACR) decrease

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on change in albuminuria (ACR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with ≥ 30% decrease in albuminuria (ACR)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on albuminuria (ACR) decrease

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with ≥ 20% improvement of protein to creatinine ratio (PCR)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on protein to creatinine ratio (PCR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with a stable (within ± 20% change) protein to creatinine ratio (PCR)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on protein to creatinine ratio (PCR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage change in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on the percentage change in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Slope of albumin to creatinine ratio (ACR) decline
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on albumin to creatinine ratio (ACR) decline rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Slope of estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) decline
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) decline rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with progression of chronic kidney disease (CKD)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of crizanlizumab + standard of care compared to standard of care alone on the progression of chronic kidney disease (CKD)

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity: measurement of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) to crizanlizumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to follow-up period, at select time points approx. 1 year and 4 months
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the immunogenicity of crizanlizumab over the study period

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized rate of visits to emergency room and hospitalizations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to follow-up period, approx. 1 year and 4 months
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate healthcare resource utilization (visits to emergency room and hospitalizations) due to Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) events, Vaso-occlusive crisis (VOCs), or other Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) complications.

arm_group.description: 5 mg/kg by intravenous infusion at Week 1 Day 1, Week 3 Day 1 and Day 1 of every 4-week cycle until Week 51 in addition to their usual standard of care treatment.
Patients in the standard of care alone arm will continue to receive their usual standard of care treatment.

intervention.description: Crizanlizumab is a concentrate for solution for infusion, i.v. use. Supplied in single use 10 mL vials at a concentration of 10 mg/mL. One vial contains 100 mg of crizanlizumab
HU/HC (hydroxyurea/hydroxycarbamide), ACE (angiotensin-converting enzyme)inhibitors, and ARBs (angiotensin-receptor blocker)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of SCD (HbSS and HbSβ0-thal SCD genotypes are eligible)
- Patients with eGFR ≥ 45 to ≤ 120 mL/min/1.73 m2 based on CKD EPI formula
- Patients with ACR of ≥ 100 to < 2000 mg/g
- Receiving standard of care drug(s) for SCD and/or CKD for at least 6 months prior to study entry
- Hb ≥ 4.0 g/dL, absolute neutrophil count (ANC) ≥ 1.0 x 109/L, and platelet count ≥ 75 x 109/L
- Written informed consent (or assent/ parental consent for minor subjects) prior to any screening procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of stem cell transplant
- Patients with evidence of AKI within 3 months of study entry
- Blood pressure > 140/90 mmHg despite treatment
- Patients undergoing hemodialysis
- Received blood products within 30 days of Week 1 Day 1
- Participating in a chronic transfusion program
- History of kidney transplant
- Patients with hypoalbuminemia
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

facility.name: Our Lady of the Lake Regional Medical Center

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent expert panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data is currently available according to the process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com.
